Easily one of the best games I've ever played.

The gameplay is satisfying and entertaining. The shooting is responsive and there's always something new, whether it be a new gun to play with, a new vigor to test, or a new enemy to kill. The game always feels fresh and never really has a low point.

The story is really the thing that makes this game incredible. The entire story is so elaborate. Each time you play through it, you will notice things that you didn't understand the first time through. The game will make more and more sense with each playthrough. The ending is the best ending I've ever seen in a game to date. It might be hard to wrap your head around at first, but when you finally understand it, it will blow your mind.

If you're on the fence about this game, I can tell you right now, it's worth every penny. I cannot recommend this game enough.

Önceki oyunları oynanamış olmama rağmen internett gördüğüm övgüler üzerine satın aldım. Ki hak eden bir oyunmuş bence. Senaryo çok güzel. Kısa bir özet geçecek olursam eski bir polis-dedektif(tam anlamadım o kısmı) olan Booker'ın gözünden oynuyoruz. Bizi ydünyada yaşanan siyası olaylar sonucunda gökyüzüne taşınan Columbia'ya bir kızı kaçırmak için yolluyorlar. Bunu başardığımızda ise borcumuz kapanmış olacak. Kalanını alatırsam spoiler olur :(.

Oynanış açısından ise standart FPS lerden farklı olan 2 büyük özelliği var. Birincisi vigor denilen içecekler. Bunlar vücudunuzda bazı değişikler meydana getirerek özel yetenekler kazanmanızı sağlıyor. Bu oyunda büyü olarak geçmediği için öyle açıkladım ama kısaca can barına ek olarak bir mana barınız var ve toplam 8 özel yeteneği normal silahlarınızı kullanmaya devam ederken kullanabiliyorsunuz. Düşmanlarınıza bir karga sürüsü yollamak bunlardan birisi mesala. İkinci olarak da belki  de o kadar dikket çekecek bir özellik değil ama Sky-Line sistemi geliyor. Şehir gökyüzünde olduğu için adalar arası geçişler için kullanılan bu ray sistemlerinde vagonlar bulunabildiği gibi özel olarak tasarlanmış bir alet ile insanlar da bu rayları kullanabiliyor. Ray üzerinde hareket ederken hızınız yüksek olduğı için isabet ettirilme şansınız düşüyor. Ayrınca kaçışlar için de ideal bir yöntem. Tabi ki şu an strateji yazısı yazmadığım için bu kadarı yeterli. Son olarak insan beyninin anıları bulunmadığında kendi kendine anılaroluşturabileceğini unutmayın. (Adam şizofren veya hepsi rüya çıkmayacak merak etmeyin)

Bird, or cage? [SPOILER-FREE REVIEW]

INTRO
Bioshock Infinie is a beautiful game that put you in Columbia, a city obove the clouds. It deliveres in every aspect and make for a truly enjoyable game.

STORY
Bioshock Infinite send you away to a vibrant and glorious world above the clouds; Columbia. Columbia is a city driven by religion, loyalty and... well propellers. As soon as you enter this uncanny realm you are faced with a people that devote their entire spectrum into religion; and of course their one true leader: Combstock. Combstock is the "villian" of Bioshock Infinite, and is trying to put a stop to YOU. Who are you? You are Mr. Dewitt. Dewitt is a character that has been forced to kidnap Combstock's daughter; Elizabeth. However she has in a Super Mario-esc way been trapped in a tower where she awaits to be saved by her true hero. The game manages well to capture the clear divine between Elizabeth and Dewitt. You are constantly seeing how Elizabeth has to face all these new revelations she explores whilst playing, and how it affects her. You start developing emotional connections to the characters and so you respond more easily to their actions. Simple things as Elizabeths haircut can show in what state of mind she is currently in. All these feelings become crutial at the end of the game, and without spoiling anything I can only say that it was memorable and made all the emotions feel essential.

GAMEPLAY
Bioshock Infinite is a First Person Shooter and focuses it's gameplay around three core elements:
- Guns
- Vigors
- Gears

GUNS are your main weapon in Infinite, and vary from small one-handed pistols to big RPG's. When I played I found myself experimenting with different weapons all the time, and making all upgrades you did on one specifc gun transfer to any copy of that gun you found, made it easier for me to pick up new unique weapons that I found along the way. Even though I felt a bit frustrated at times when I found three special guns at once, and had to make a sacrifise to one of them and leave them behind, I would always find something to compensate for it. When I played, I also realised how the game tried to hint at me to use a special weapon they left for me to grab like a sniper rifle, and such where they designed for me to use it. This WOULD make it relativly blatant, however you are completely free to choose whatever playstyle you desire. Since I never really liked being stealthy in this game, even when the game purged me to be so, it still felt enjoyable and natural to blast everyone with a flaregun.

VIGORS are special powers that transfered from the Bioshock I & II (Both in which I've played). Throughout the game you pick up different Vigors like Devil's Kiss, Murder of Crows, Possession, Shock Jockey and many more. The different vigors grant you unique abilities like being able to turn an enemy into your ally, or set up a fireball on the ground that explodes when enemies come close to it. All of these skills are run by salts, which is basically your "mana". Salts can be found through out the game like you would with guns, and medical kits. Vigors are, however, stuck with you once you learn them. They won't dissapear when you've run out of salts. The salts gave me a feeling of superiorety over my foes, and all where balanced into a way that made them understandable, and enjoyable.

GEARS are different apparell that you pick up. They are built up by four categories; hats, tunics, leggings and boots. Wearing the different gears grants you minor boosts like a minor shiled boost, or a chance to light an enemy on fire when stabbing them. Although gears can be lifesaving at times, I didn't really pay close attention to what I was wearing and hardly changed because of it.

GRAPHICS
There isn't really much I have to say about the graphics for this game, other then the obvious, which is that they are beautiful. All the colors are made vibrant and Columbia was prettier that I could ever imagine. The color pallete is, however, a bit varied from the predisessors but that is not a bad thing.

SUMMARY
Bioshock Infinite is the best game I have ever played in my life. That is a big statement for any gamer to say, and I don't even feel bad about saying it. It offeres a fun and dynamic gameplay that most people would enjoy, with beatiful music, graphics and voiceacting. Infinite offers one of the best stories in any video game and immerses you into a beautiful and vibrant world.

As thousands of other reviews will say, this is one of the very best-looking games around at present and the gameplay of the main game is superb. The pacing and the range of environments and characters keeps drawing you in. There are lots of lovely little details like the barbershop quartet or the miniature dramas being played out in the NPC dialogue you overhear as you pass. Normal difficulty is perhaps a little too easy; I kept waiting for the time when I would really have to learn how to use my full range of plasmids instead of just sticking with a couple, but that moment never came. Still, the fantastic rich world and quite compelling story kept bringing me back to see this game through in short order despite having many other games on the go at the same time.

DLC is a mixed bag; the developers felt obliged to change up the gameplay to keep things fresh, but the result is less fluid and enjoyable, and of course the stories are much less deep. Personally I find Episode 1 to be much more involving despite a somewhat forced attempt to reinject mystery into the protagonist, and Episode 2 starts with a stunning set piece but the eventual game is a bit of a drag, keeping me going only because I want to see the conclusion of the storyline - but perhaps that's just my lack of ability at stealth games. Definitely my stand-out game of the last couple of years.

It's as you'd expect in terms of presentation, atmosphere and style. Bioshock always deliver on all three fronts and the visuals are particularly beautiful in this game. 

The downside, however, is the combat and, more specifically, the AI. It's pretty deadful and felt like a really pretty game of Duck Hunt at times. Some of the powers in the games also aren't that great. In previous entries, the plasmid powers added an extra layer of depth to combat- especially when tackling trickier foes. That effect is lost in this iteration of Bioshock, possibly due to the lack of enemy variety as opposed to lack of powers readily available. You're rarely forced to think outside the box so it becomes a 'one power kills most enemies' kind of tactic.

All in all, it's a great experience. The story is pretty decent and the ending is pretty good (although not as mind blowing as people had me believe). It's worth a try on sale, definitely. 8/10
